result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest V Davis Jr.

defendant.name: Davis, Ernest V, Jr.
defendant.address: 218 W. Charlotte Street Apt 108, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: 11:18 AM Defendant Ernest V Davis Jr. in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Ernest V Davis Jr.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. Paige Close from Court Services is present. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1; dismiss Ct#2. 1 year DJOC w/conditions. Atty Nelson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights . Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#1, dismisses Ct#2. ADA Walker and Atty Walker address sentence-joint recommendation for DJOC. Defendant addresses the court. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 1 year DJOC. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Court will sign. Defendant to remain until he has a signed copy. 11:32
Plea hearing on August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:38 PM Defendant Ernest V Davis in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requested this matter be set for a plea, Defendant needs to meet with Ms. Brill. Court sets a  plea. 3:39  Plea hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:03 PM Defendant Ernest V Davis appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states a Plea Hearing is needed about 30 days out. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:08 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court adjourned at 1:42 pm.

1:33 PM Defendant Ernest V Davis appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Alex Hoffman. S/T. ADA Walker questions Officer. Court reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Walker is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 3:43 PM Defendant Ernest V Davis appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. Was in the Army. Court adjourned at 3:51 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
